clientserver

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • clientserver.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the class that holds all the information for the client, for the client server exchange, this holds the connection and the streams used for communicating with the server
    Author:
    Simon Glew

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Client(java.lang.String server, int port, java.lang.String username, javax.swing.JFrame menu)
      Constructor for the client, that gets called when a method within the menu class is called

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getUsername()
      Helper method to get the username of the player/client
      void sendMessage(PlayerCommand msg)
      Helper method that sends a player command through to the server
      boolean start()
      This method is the method that initially gets called when the client tries and connects to the server, it sets up a new socket, sets up the data streams for the server and client to use and sends through an initial connect message

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String server,
              int port,
              java.lang.String username,
              javax.swing.JFrame menu)
        Constructor for the client, that gets called when a method within the menu class is called
        Parameters:
        server - - The server that the client is trying to connect to
        port - - The port that the client is connecting to the server through
        username - - The username that the user has entered that is going to correspond to the client
        menu - - The menu frame that the client is using

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public boolean start()
        This method is the method that initially gets called when the client tries and connects to the server, it sets up a new socket, sets up the data streams for the server and client to use and sends through an initial connect message
        Returns:
        successful login boolean

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(PlayerCommand msg)
        Helper method that sends a player command through to the server
        Parameters:
        msg - - message getting sent through to the server

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Helper method to get the username of the player/client
        Returns:
        username
